titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Rainbow Kitchen Records, 1974-1992 AIS.1991.10
titlestmt.author: Zachary Brodt

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-06-11 09:33:40 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: Rainbow Kitchen Community Services was founded in 1984 by Bob Anderson, Theresa Chalich and Dolores Patrick, in response to the devastating community impact of the closing of area steel mills, which displaced thousands of workers living near Pittsburgh, Pa. This collection contains the records of Bob Anderson regarding the Rainbow Kitchen and other organizations which aimed to help unemployed steelworkers in the Pittsburgh area during the 1980s.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of Robert L. Anderson in July 1991.

odd.head: Previous Citation
odd.p: Rainbow Kitchen Records, 1974-1992, AIS.1991.10, Archives Service Center, University of Pittsburgh

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Rainbow Kitchen Records, 1974-1992, AIS.1991.10, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The job bank applications in Box 23 are closed for 75 years from date of creation. Until this restriction is lifted, researchers must sign a confidentiality agreement to access the records. Please contact the Archives Service Center for more information.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: Rainbow Kitchen Community Services was founded in 1984 by Bob Anderson, Theresa Chalich and Dolores Patrick, in response to the devastating community impact of the closing of area steel mills, which displaced thousands of workers living near Pittsburgh, Pa. Originally known as the Homestead Unemployed Center, the Rainbow Kitchen aims to help low income families become self sufficient through its food pantry, job training classes and other programs. Still located in Homestead, Pa., the non-profit is supported mostly through private donations, grants, and fundraising efforts.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The University of Pittsburgh holds the property rights to the material in this collection, but the copyright may still be held by the original creator/author. Researchers are therefore advised to follow the regulations set forth in the U.S. Copyright Code when publishing, quoting, or reproducing material from this collection without the consent of the creator/author or that go beyond what is allowed by fair use.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was inventoried by Zachary Brodt in 2007. It remains to be fully processed.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Mon Valley Unemployed Committee Records, 1980-1995, AIS.2002.02, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This collection contains the records of Bob Anderson regarding the Rainbow Kitchen and other organizations which aimed to help unemployed steelworkers in the Pittsburgh area during the 1980s. Included is information on the steel industry and labor union locals, as well as publications concerning deindustrialization and the political left. Files regarding celebrity endorsements of Rainbow Kitchen by Bruce Springsteen, Jesse Jackson and Ed Asner are also present, in addition to photographs, videos, slides, and newsletters.
